intro: Oxymeris debilis, commonly known as the slender oxymeris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Oxymeris debilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
